{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) is a minimally invasive procedure used to obtain cells from a suspicious mass or lesion for cytological examination. It is commonly used to diagnose various types of cancers. To determine which option is not diagnosed by FNAC, we need to consider the limitations of this procedure. FNAC is generally not sufficient to diagnose follicular carcinoma of the thyroid because it cannot distinguish between follicular adenoma and follicular carcinoma. Therefore, the answer is B. Follicular carcinoma of thyroid.", "answer_choice": "B"}
